class.name: OleFormat
class.description: Represents the OLE characteristics (other than linking) for an OLE object, ActiveX control, or field.

properties.name: classType
properties.description: Specifies the class type for the specified OLE object, picture, or field.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: Specifies the icon that is used when the `displayAsIcon` property is `true`.

properties.name: iconLabel
properties.description: Specifies the text displayed below the icon for the OLE object.

properties.name: iconName
properties.description: Specifies the program file in which the icon for the OLE object is stored.

properties.name: iconPath
properties.description: Gets the path of the file in which the icon for the OLE object is stored.

properties.name: isDisplayedAsIcon
properties.description: Gets whether the specified object is displayed as an icon.

properties.name: isFormattingPreservedOnUpdate
properties.description: Specifies whether formatting done in Microsoft Word to the linked OLE object is preserved.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Gets a string that's used to identify the portion of the source file that's being linked.

properties.name: progID
properties.description: Gets the programmatic identifier (`ProgId`) for the specified OLE object.

methods.name: activateAs
methods.description: Sets the Windows registry value that determines the default application used to activate the specified OLE object.

params.name: classType
params.description: The class type to activate as.

methods.name: doVerb
methods.description: Requests that the OLE object perform one of its available verbs.

params.name: verbIndex
params.description: Optional. The index of the verb to perform.

params.name: verbIndex
params.description: Optional. The index of the verb to perform.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Opens the OLE object for editing in the application it was created in.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.OleFormat` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.OleFormatData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.
